articles.title: Turkish operator says Ghosn used its jets illegally in escape from Japan
articles.description: Turkish private aircraft operator MNG Jet said on Friday that its planes were used illegally in the escape from Japan of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, adding it had filed a criminal complaint.
articles.content:
ISTANBUL (Reuters) - Turkish private aircraft operator MNG Jet said on Friday that its planes were used illegally in the escape from Japan of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, adding it had filed a criminal complaint.

articles.title: Australian wildfires consume guitar enthusiast's prized collection
articles.description: Australian Michael Hillman fled from harrowing bushfires that hit the beachside town of Malua Bay on New Year's Eve, only to be faced with a scene of devastation when he returned on Friday.
articles.content:
BATEMANS BAY, Australia (Reuters) - Australian Michael Hillman fled from harrowing bushfires that hit the beachside town of Malua Bay on New Year’s Eve, only to be faced with a scene of devastation when he returned on Friday.

articles.title: U.S. embassy urges citizens to depart Iraq immediately: statement
articles.description: The United States embassy in Baghdad urged on Friday all citizens to depart Iraq immediately, hours after the U.S. killed Iranian Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis in an air strike.

BAGHDAD (Reuters) - The United States embassy in Baghdad urged on Friday all citizens to depart Iraq immediately, hours after the U.S. killed Iranian Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis in an air strike.

articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah to continue path of Iranian commander after U.S. strike: TV
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah said on Friday his powerful Shi'ite militia group would continue the path of Iran's Major-General Qassem Soleimani after his death in a U.S. air strike, broadcaster Al Manar reported.

articles.title: Kenyan shilling stable as business resumes for new year
articles.description: The Kenyan shilling was stable on Friday with inflows from remittances and offshore investors buying government debt meeting dollar demand from merchandise importers, traders said.
articles.content:
NAIROBI (Reuters) - The Kenyan shilling was stable on Friday with inflows from remittances and offshore investors buying government debt meeting dollar demand from merchandise importers, traders said.

articles.title: France to work for Middle East stability after U.S. strike: minister
articles.description: France's priority is to stabilize the Middle East, French Junior Foreign Affairs Minister Amelie de Montchalin said on Friday after a U.S. air strike killed Iran's Quds Force commander Qassem Soleimani.
articles.content:

articles.title: Flights suspended in Libya's capital due to rocket fire, says official
articles.description: Flights were suspended until further notice at the only functioning airport in Libya's capital Tripoli on Friday due to rockets falling nearby, an airport official said.
articles.content:
TRIPOLI (Reuters) - Flights were suspended until further notice at the only functioning airport in Libya’s capital Tripoli on Friday due to rockets falling nearby, an airport official said.

articles.title: European shares slide after U.S. air strike in Iraq
articles.description: European shares slipped from near record-highs on Friday as geopolitical tensions flared after a U.S. air strike in Iraq killed a top Iranian commander.

articles.title: With fates intertwined, Mexico and Pemex face downgrade risk in 2020
